intro: Galium pabulosum, commonly known as stickyweed or silverweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered in fine, sticky hairs. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are often lance-shaped and have a silvery underside. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Galium pabulosum thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks.
